subject: Travel
title: The Space Tourists
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Space Tourists.

hook.text: In 2001, Dennis Tito paid $20 million to ride a Russian rocket to the International Space Station.

buildup.text: NASA opposed it. They said a tourist in space was dangerous and unprofessional.

discovery.text: Tito spent eight days orbiting Earth. He called it the greatest experience of his life.

twist.text: By 2021, SpaceX, Blue Origin, and Virgin Galactic were all selling tourist flights.

climax.text: A seat on a SpaceX flight now costs about $55 million. The waitlist is years long.

punchline.text: Space is the next tourist destination.

quiz.question: Who was the first space tourist?
